Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that "Six states can't get the votes counted" when in reality, there were delays in counting due to an influx of mail-in ballots in some states.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by implying that the delays in vote counting are intentional and favoring Democrats, without providing sufficient evidence to support this assertion.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence presented to back up the claim that Democrats are deliberately delaying ballot counts in the mentioned six states.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the delays in vote counting are a deliberate attempt by Democrats to hurt President Trump's re-election chances, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides alternative explanations for the delays in vote counting, such as an influx of mail-in ballots and reporting delays due to the time it takes to count mail ballots compared to in-person votes.
